meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being northern or of the north.
meanings.sent1: The nordicity of the landscape was evident in the snow-capped mountains.
meanings.sent2: She loved the nordicity of the winter weather, with its cold winds and frosty mornings.
meanings.sent3: The nordicity of the penguin's habitat made it feel right at home in the icy waters.
meanings.sent4: The nordicity of his personality shone through in his preference for cooler climates.
meanings.sent5: The nordicity of the Arctic Circle was breathtaking, with its endless expanse of snow and ice.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being related to or characteristic of the Nordic countries.
meanings.sent1: The nordicity of the cuisine in that restaurant reflected the flavors of the Nordic countries.
meanings.sent2: Her scarf had a hint of nordicity in its design, reminiscent of traditional Nordic patterns.
meanings.sent3: The nordicity of the music festival brought a touch of Scandinavian charm to the town.
meanings.sent4: His paintings captured the nordicity of the landscapes in Sweden and Norway with remarkable detail.
meanings.sent5: The nordicity of the language spoken by the tour guide added an authentic Nordic feel to the experience.
